snippet: Meetings between government officials and the real estate industry focused on creating a clearinghouse that would match families in need with empty apartments.
abstract: Federal officials are asking New York City landlords to work with them to make vacant apartments available to thousands of families displaced by Hurricane Sandy; goal is to create a system that would allow potential tenants to pay rent directly with Federal Emergency Management Agency vouchers, or obtain such apartments through relief agencies like the American Red Cross.
lead_paragraph: Meetings between government officials and the real estate industry focused on creating a clearinghouse that would match families in need with empty apartments.

headline.seo: U.S. Seeks Pool of Vacant Units From N.Y.C. Landlords
headline.main: U.S. Asks New York Landlords for Vacant Apartments to House Displaced Families
headline.print_headline: U.S. Asks New York Landlords for Vacant Apartments to House Displaced Families

keywords.value: Real Estate Board of New York
keywords.name: organizations
